Description.val:
Funding in this P-1 line provides for the procurement of tactical Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) equipment that will be installed aboard ships and in the facilities at the TRIDENT Refit Facility (TRIREFFAC), Navy Intermediate Maintenance Facility (NAVIMFAC) and TRIDENT Training Facility (TRITRAFAC).  The TRIDENT Refit Facility and Navy Intermediate Maintenance Facility (NAVIMFAC) are dedicated shore support facilities providing a full range of industrial support.  The TRITRAFAC provides the crews for the OHIO Class (SSBN/SSGN) Submarines with realistic training experience in operating and maintaining shipboard equipment. The growth in this line is due to procurement and installation of OHIO CLASS Ship Control Station Obsolete Equipment Replacement (SCS OER).

[P40A / HH009 EQUIPMENT HM&E & SWS/SS ALTERATION]: This provides for the replacement of obsolete equipment on board of OHIO Class Submarines and at dedicated Shore Support Facilities (TLCSF, TRITRAFAC (B), NAVIMFAC (B), TRITRAFAC (KB), TRIREFFAC (KB), Major Shore Spares (MSS)).  These alterations are necessary in order to replace obsolete/outdated equipment with new equipment to maintain or increase mission capabilities, replace or modify components/systems which have proven to be unreliable, correct design and safety problems and reduce fleet maintenance burdens.  Funds provide for multiple efforts to ensure that the OHIO Class Ship Control Subsystem, both hardware and software components, support the extended life of the OHIO Class submarine platforms.  In FY99 and again in FY06 a NUWC KEYPORT study identified a number of obsolete electronic components in the Ship Control Station (27 out of 107) that are no longer available. The FY06 study recommended that the Ship Control ISEA develop and execute a program that would address the near term obsolescence issues and ensure the continued availability of the subsystem in the out years.  Alterations and actions are done at the lowest practicable and authorized level (taking into consideration urgency, priority, capability, capacity and cost).  Alterations to OHIO Class Submarines are scheduled for accomplishment at the TRIREFFAC, Kings Bay, NAVIMFAC, Bangor, and at Naval Shipyards during Depot Availabilities.  This requires equipment procurement and installation, technical planning, training, and associated resources.  This line provides for material procurement necessary to install the required alterations to OHIO Class Submarines.  Commencing in FY19 funding is provided for upgrading Laboratory facilities at Electric Boat Corporation  and Naval Undersea Warfare Center Newport Rhode Island and at the Trident Training Facilities in Kings Bay Georgia and Bangor Washington.  This upgrade is required so the Ship Control  Laboratory facilities and the Trident Training Facilities are current with installed Ohio Class Ship Control Systems.  This upgrade completes in FY21. 
                                                                                                               
Additionally, this line provides for the utilization of specially trained and dedicated installation teams to ensure accelerated and correct installation of complex and high priority alterations within specific time frames.  Provided are comprehensive program management and execution, including planning, direction, control, installation, integration, and coordination of specifically selected safety related, mission enhancement or technical HM&E alterations.  Starting in FY19, the SSBN Strategic Weapon Support Systems (SWSS) program includes a Sustainability effort, which maintains the SWSS surveillance, modernization and obsolescence management program.  This line monitors and predicts SWSS obsolescence issues and plans for program modernization to address predicted obsolescence, reliability or maintainability issues to ensure OHIO class submarines continue to meet mission requirements to end of life until replaced by the COLUMBIA Class.  Items anticipated may include; Harvesting Critical Components, Reverse Engineering, Form-Fit-Function replacements, providing lifetime buys, providing component-level SHIPALTs (reactive). Starting in FY20, funding is for replacement Trim/Drain Pump motors as the current installed motors are obsolete and not supportable to end of life for OHIO Class SSBNs and SSGNs. The manufacturer of the OHIO Class Trim and Drain pump motor closed their facility. Leverages VA Class motors as replacements, but requires non-recurring engineering, qualification funding for arrangement, power connection and integrated logistics support changes and install funding as a backfit SHIPALT. Also in FY20, begin funding replacement for High Pressure Air Compressor (HPAC) programmable logic controllers (PLCs) that are obsolete, and replacements are no longer available. PLCs on OHIO Class are no longer supported by the stock system and repair parts are not available. Funds support non-recurring engineering to develop a refresh modification and ILS support for the PLC on existing HPAC TRIPER assets. Once the PLC upgrade design is qualified, kits will be procured to install on each TRIPER asset during unit overhaul to support in-service OHIO class submarines.

[P40A / HH012 EQUIPMENT HM&E TRIDENT ENGINGEERING AVAILABILITY]: TRIDENT Engineered Availability (EA) support funding is required to provide system engineering, technical, logistic and configuration management support for all accomplished modernization during the SSBN 726 Class Submarine Engineered Availabilities (EAs) commencing in FY93 and continuing through the operational life of the submarine.  This program also provides funding for Quality Assurance (QA) oversight and certification by Supervisor Of Shipbuilding, Groton (SOS Groton) of  SHIPALTS performed by Electric Boat Corporation (EB), provides funding to the Planning Yard for Configuration Record change and Liaison Action Request processing, and Selected Record Drawings mark ups for SHIPALT-related work, accomplishment of availability work package requirements assigned to the Planning Yard such as Design Review hanger inspections, Integrated Logistic Support product updates, and Configuration Overhaul Planning Product development and distribution for each availability.  The program also provides funding for NUWC Newport system-level final end-to-end certification test development and onboard test conduct and analysis to support end of CNO availability certification of entire Command and Control system as ready for sea and strategic deployment. This system-level engineering support is provided during Engineered Refueling Overhauls (ERO), Extended Refit Periods (ERPs), and Maintenance & Modernization  Periods (MMPs).

[P40A / HH0GN SSGN MODIFICATIONS]: Provides for procurement of SSGN unique system components that will be installed during planned modernization periods.  Also provides funding to perform integrated testing of these unique systems to ensure satisfactory operation with other HM&E and Combat Systems.  Funds are provided for procurement of Submarine Special Operations Forces (SOF) unique system components that will be installed during planned modernization periods. Starting in FY22, all funding for SOF in FY22-25 transferred to BLI 0941.

[P40A / SOF HH0GN]: Funds are provided for installation of Submarine Special Operations Forces (SOF) unique system components.  Starting in FY22, all funding for SOF in FY22-25 transferred to BLI 0941.

Justification.val: While per unit procurement and install costs remain the same across the FYDP (save for inflation) for the Ship Control Station (SCS) OER Program, FY21 reflects increased funding compared to FY20 due to the planned number of ancillary material procurement kits supporting installations. Installations are tied to support ship's maintenance availability schedules. This upgrade is delivered during scheduled ship availabilities and accomplishes three installations in FY21, as compared to only one in FY20.

Name.val: 1.2) SWSS SSBN/SSGN Hovering System DP Transducers

Name.@footnote: Ship Control Station OER Material funds identified are for ancillary material kits required to set up and support shipset installations.  The increase from FY20 to FY21 is due to two additional material kit procurements; FY20 has (1), and FY21 has (3).

The SCS OER Lab/TTF Equip Upgrade is required to ensure shore maintenance and training facility equipment is similar to ship installation in order support operational issues and ensure training  at the TTFs  matches the latest installed configuration of Ship Control Systems in the fleet.

Starting in FY20, funding is for replacement Trim/Drain Pump motors as the current installed motors are obsolete and not supportable to end of life for OHIO Class SSBNs and SSGNs. Leverages VA Class motors as replacements, but requires nonrecurring engineering, qualification funding for arrangement, power and foundation connection, and integrated logistics support changes and install funding as a backfit SHIPALT.
Name.val: 1.7) Ohio Class Trim/Drain Pump Motor Replacement

Name.@footnote: Starting in FY20, funding is for replacement for High Pressure Air Compressor (HPAC) programmable logic controllers (PLCs) that are obsolete. PLCs on OHIO Class are no longer supported by the stock system and repair parts are not available. Funds support non-recurring engineering to develop a refresh modification and ILS support for the PLC. Upgrade kits will be procured to install on each TRIPER asset during scheduled HPAC overhaul.
Name.val: 1.8) Ohio Class High Pressure Air Compressor Controllers
2) HH012 EQUIPMENT HM&E TRIDENT ENGINGEERING AVAILABILITY

Name.@footnote: FY21 efforts continue to drive to completion necessary backlogs for Configuration Record changes, Liaison Action Request processing, Selected Record Drawings (SRD) mark ups for SHIPALT-related work, accomplishment of availability work package (AWP) requirements assigned to the Planning Yard such as Design Review hanger inspections, Integrated Logistic Support product updates, and Configuration Overhaul Planning Product development for each availability (ERP/ERO). This paperwork is vital to not only properly sustaining each Strategic boat by ensuring clear and accurate configuration control of capabilities installed in each hull, but also to execute expedient development and incorporation of new technology onboard these Strategic platforms.

ModificationTitle.val: EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC

Title.val: EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC

Name.val: 1.1.1) EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC

Description.val:
SSBN Ship Control Obsolete Equipment Replacement - Perform multiple efforts to ensure that the OHIO Class Ship Control Subsystem, both hardware and software components, support the extended life of the OHIO Class submarine platforms. 

Note: Production lead-time for Ship Control System OER is 17 months.

[EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC] Installations of this SHIPALT are accomplished during SSBN refits, SSBN Extended Refit Periods (ERP), SSGN Major Maintenance Periods (MMP), and SSBN Engineered Refueling Overhauls (ERO). Installations do not complete until the availability completes. Thus the installation duration ranges from 90 days for refit installations to 821 days for ERO installations. By design, Ship Control ShipAlt TRID 588B is conjunctive with SSBN Modernization ShipAlt TRID601, which upgrades SSBNs to TI-16 sonar/fire control systems.  The TI-16 fielding plan was accelerated by OPNAV and sonar/fire control PARMs.  This additional funding for Ship Control ShipAlt TRID 588B allows accelerating installations into FY19, FY21 & FY22 to match the current TI-16 installation scheduled for SSBNs.  

Installation costs vary due to the number of installations, location and type of installation, e.g. ship or facility.

The one procurement in FY21 for SCS OER equipment supports installation in 2nd quarter of FY22. 

The increase in funding budgeted from FY20 to FY21 is due to additional ship set installations being accomplished in FY21. In FY20, (1) installation is budgeted. In FY21 there are (3) installations.  While the per shipset unit procurement and installation costs remain the same across the FYDP, the planned number of shipset procurements and installations is tied to support ships availability schedules.

[SCS SSBN/SSGN INSTALLATION DSA] DSA costs vary due to the number of installations, location and type of installation, e.g. ship or facility.
